Fields.DialogueText: Well, look at that, Nautilus. I knew that pearl would look amazing on you.
Golly, Captain. You think so?
Of course, I think it made a lovely necklace.
I suppose...
Is everything all right? You seem a little down.
The pearl is nice and everything, but it's not the same. I guess I just still miss Narwhal's pearl.

Fields.MenuText: That makes sense. I wasn't really trying to replace it. I just wanted to get you something nice.
I guess my plan failed, then. Here I was, trying to make you forget all about that.
Was Narwhal's pearl really that much nicer?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yes, I know, and it's a beautiful gift. Looking at it just sometimes reminds me of that loss.
You did something wonderful for me. I love it, but I also think feeling it around my neck is just a reminder of the pearl I lost.
It's not about how it looked. It's about what it meant. It was a gift from Narwhal, and that meant a lot.
I'm just being all melodramatic. I'll get over it and be right as rain soon enough. Don't you worry, Captain.
Okay, if you say so. Maybe I should've gotten you something else. Like another new camera for you to lose.
Hey, I don't lose them, I...
*ALARM*
I blame the Morganas!
Then let's take it out on them. Apparently they owe us a few cameras.
@BATTLE
Hello there, Cap! I thought you were going to hit the hay for a bit. What are you doing up?
Actually, I was hoping to help you with your training.
Really?! You want to help me practice for the All Belle Games?!

Fields.MenuText: Is that so hard to believe?
Of course, you're going to need all the help you can get, after all.
I just want to help as much as I can.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, a little. I was starting to think you weren't interested in the games at all.
Ha! Well, thanks for the vote of confidence, Cap.
Well, good. I'll take all the help I can get.
All right now, where do we start? How do we get this training ball rolling?
Hmmm, well, I usually start off with some laps around the sub. Care to join me, Cap?
Tempting, but I can't walk through walls like you. How about I stay in here instead and count your laps?
Oh, that could be helpful. I usually don't keep track of that. I kind of just go until I'm tired.
Well, I suppose that's one way to do it, but let's see how many laps you can do in five minutes.
*ALARM*
Uh oh, looks like we're gonna have to put this off for a little while.
Maybe it's for the best. It'll give me time to find my stopwatch.
@BATTLE
All right, Cap. Let's get this training going.

Fields.MenuText: I'm ready, let's get rolling!
This is going to adversely affect my sleep schedule for a while, isn't it?
You're going to have to give me a minute to get as energized as you, Nautilus.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the attitude I'm looking for, Cap!
Probably so. There's no time for laziness now!
Do you want to do some jumping jacks or something? That always helps me!
How are you always so full of energy, Nautilus? It's kind of amazing.
Is it really that unusual?
Do you see anyone else around here bouncing up and down?
Maybe it's something in my diet.
Well, what are you eating?
I like crab. I eat a looooot of crab.
Yeah, I don't think it's all the crab.
*ALARM*
Oh, come on! We haven't even had time to train yet.
We can train right after this battle. And then, after that, we can celebrate with some crab.
Mmmmm, I like the sound of that.
@BATTLE
How'd I do, Cap?
Really well. Fifteen laps, I'm impressed.
You think I've got what it takes to get the gold?

Fields.MenuText: Definitely! You're going to win all the golds!
Hmmm, I'd say you're good enough for a silver. You're almost to gold, though.
At this point, I doubt you'd even medal. You've got a long way to go.

Fields.DialogueText: Aww, you're just saying that, Cap. I'm not that good just yet.
That sounds about right. I've definitely got more work ahead of me.
Oh, really? I hope I've got enough time to train before the actual games.
Let's get back to it, Nautilus. Can't start slacking now.
I couldn't say it any better myself. Should I go for some more laps? Or, should I practice my diving a little? Oh, what about the potato sack race?!
Take it easy, we still have time to cover everything. Let's just start with a few more laps and then see where the training takes us.
You're right as rain again, Cap. Let's do this!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
First things first, I suppose...
Look at this, Nautilus! Looks like we've got a location for the All Belle Games.
Golly, already?! I thought I had more time!

Fields.MenuText: How much time did you think you had?
Nautilus, stay calm. You're going to do great. I believe in you.
The sooner the better! Let's get to the games!

Fields.DialogueText: Macaroni, I don't know! Just more than this.
You're sure? I'm going to have to do great if I'm going to stand a chance against all those other Belles.
Can't you see I'm a little worried here, Cap!?
I still have so much I wanted to do before the games! So much practice, so much training!
Hey, we still have to make our way there. You have plenty of time.
Really? I... I guess you're right... Okay, I can breathe again. Thanks, Cap.
I don't think I've ever seen you so panicked before.
Well, it just snuck up on me. I don't like being snuck up on. Keep that in mind.
Maybe I'll start wearing a bell around you.
Hehe, you don't have to go that far, Cap.
*ALARM*
Morganas. I wish they would put a bell on for us.
Well then, what would we need our alarm for?
Good point.
@BATTLE
Oh, Cap, look at those mountains! Can we go mountain climbing?
Nautilus, get off the periscope. We need to get back to training.
But, look, there's a city at the base of the mountain. We should go and visit them!
Okay, you're getting distracted. The periscope's going away now. Let's go.
Come on, we could train and have some fun. I think I saw a forest. We could go camping. We could sharpen our survivalist abilities!
I seriously doubt they're gonna have a survivalist competition at the All Belle Games.
*Sigh* You're right, you're right. Thanks, Cap. This is why I need your help.

Fields.MenuText: Because you're easily distracted?
Because I'm strong enough to drag you away from the periscope?
Because I'm just that good looking?

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't say I'm... Hmmm? Oh, right. Yeah, I can be easily distracted sometimes.
Well, who else could've dragged me away? That guy with the hat? I doubt it.
No, Cap, don't be silly. Though I will admit, it's a trait of yours I don't mind.
All right, let's do this! I'm done being distracted.
Perfect. Let's get to diving practice. Let's go for that new record.
New record? What's the old record? I didn't set it, did I?
*Sigh* Remember what we were just saying about distractions, Nautilus?
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
*CRASH*
Ooooh, ouuuuch!
Nautilus, what happened!? Were you training without me?
You were busy, and I wanted to get in some last minute practice.
You know you could've asked. I would've dropped what I was doing.
I know, I know. I just... I thought I could handle jump-roping on my own. Looks like I was wrong.

Fields.MenuText: Never trust a jump rope.
A jump rope? What were you doing with a jump rope on a submarine? Where'd you even get it?
I didn't realize there was a jump roping competition in the games.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that's a lesson I learned today, Cap.
You can get a lot of interesting stuff at port. You'd be amazed at what falls in the water there.
There isn't, that would be silly. I just heard that it was a good way to train.
Why don't we throw that old, rotting rope away? I'm pretty certain it's a safety hazard. Besides, I'm here now, so we can work on your training together.
Great! I'd much rather practice with you anyway. What first?
I was thinking we could practice that potato sack race a little more.
Perfect! I'll grab my practice sack!
You have your own sack?
Doesn't everybody?
@BATTLE
Uh...
*ALARM*
There are a lot more Belles here than I was expecting to show up.
Even Belles need a break every once in a while to have a little fun. You'd be surprised how competitive some of us can get.

Fields.MenuText: I'm guessing you're here for the fun?
Are you one of those competitive sorts?
I guess you learn new things about Belles everyday.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, pretty much. As long as we're all having a good time, I'm happy.
Not so much. I don't care about winning as much as I do about having a good time. Although, of course, what's more fun than winning, huh, Cap?
I'm guessing we'll both be learning a whole lot about Belles during these games. I can't wait to see what some of these girls can do.
All right, so let's look at our schedule here. What's up first?
Looks like we've got diving first.
Diving, huh? I'm feeling a little more confident after our practice, but I know some of the other Belles are expert divers.
What about the obstacle course? That seems more up your alley.
Hmmm... I could handle an obstacle course. Sounds fun, actually.
Then the sprint, the potato sack race, and finally we finish with the javelin toss.
Javelin toss? That's interesting.
*ALARM*
I wish we had some javelins to toss at these guys.
We don't need javelins. We're surrounded by other Belles. We easily outnumber the Morganas. They picked the wrong place to show up.
You have a good point. This is going to be a massacre.
@BATTLE
That... was... so embarrassing!
What happened?
I was talking to some of the foreign Belles and... I completely forgot everything I had learned.
All the French I'd been practicing, all the Russian, and Japanese I'd rehearsed for the games... Everything was just gone!

Fields.MenuText: You forgot entire languages? That's a whole new level of forgetful.
I'm sure it was just nerves, or the stress, or something.
At least you remember English. I'm sure that's enough to communicate with a lot of the Belles.

Fields.DialogueText: I know! I was studying French so hard too! How did it all just fly out of my head like that?
Maybe... I hope you're right... The only thing I can remember to say in Russian is no. Nein.
That's not the point! I wanted to impress them! Instead, I've just made a fool out of myself...
Now I'll never get to read Vi... Vin... I can't even remember what "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea" is in French!
Hey, we can worry about languages later. I'll even help you, but the games are starting soon. You don't want to focus on all this right now, do you?
You're right, Cap. Let's do a quick patrol or something. I need to clear my head.
Sure thing.
And, uh, Cap... would you really help me with the language stuff?
Sure, we'll find some time for a tutoring session or two.
You're a sweetheart! Although I might need more than that...
We'll have plenty of free time once the games are over.
Oh, that's a good point, Cap! I can't wait!
Wait, I think that's German.
Honeysuckle!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
First we take care of these Morganas. I know you didn't forget how to fight, right?
Right, Cap!
I'm sorry you lost, Nautilus, but... That was an intense first competition.
I know, right? Even with all our training, there were some Belles who were able to dive twice as far as me. How do they even do that?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should ask them to coach you instead of me.
I don't know. I'd say they're not human, but we already knew that.
I want to say it has something to do with buoyancy, but I can't really be sure.

Fields.DialogueText: No, you're my coach, and I wouldn't trade you for the world, Cap.
Yeah, that excuse doesn't work as well when none of the competitors are human.
Well, I wasn't expecting an actual answer. You're smart, but you're not a scientist or anything.
Losing the first competition isn't how I wanted to start the games, but there's nothing to be done about it now. What's next?
That would be the obstacle course. Personally, I think you've got this one in the bag.
I'm glad you're so confident, Cap, but we won't be sure until we see the actual course.
Well, that makes sense. I think your chances are better for this one. I doubt diving ability will help anyone this time.
What will help is limbering up. Let's go stretch out my muscles with a good fight.
@BATTLE
Consider it done. Morganas make challenging obstacles, after all.
That was amazing, Nautilus!
Golly, Cap, thanks, but the obstacle course was underwater. You could hardly see me.
Oh, please, you're quite the sight out there, even underwater. I could see you.
Really? Well, I hope I put on a good show.

Fields.MenuText: It was a great show. I could watch you kick ass for hours.
I didn't have the best vantage point, but what I did see was gold.
Eh, I ought to jump in the water and watch the competition from there.

Fields.DialogueText: Then let's hope I do as good in the rest of the games, right?
An apt choice of words, Cap!
I have a pair of goggles if you want them. I think they'd look great on you.
*ALARM*
Oh, come on! I was riding high after that last victory.
Just think of this as yet another opportunity for victory.
I like the way you think, Cap. Not even the Morganas are gonna get me down!
@BATTLE
I'm really sorry about that, Nautilus. It was a close race.
Nah, not really. They were miles ahead of me. I'm surprised I was able to get third.
Then why are you smiling? You can't say stuff like that with such a wide smile.
I still had a good time. I'm loving this. Aren't you, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: I can think of worse ways to be spending my time.
I'm not complaining. You Belles certainly know how to put on a show.
I'm having the best time. I just wish there was some place I could buy souvenirs!

Fields.DialogueText: Well, don't be thinking about worse things. Keep your mind on enjoying the games!
Just wait until the potato sack race. I've got a feeling that'll be one for the ages!
Oh, souvenirs is a great idea! We've gotta do that next time. I'll bring it up with the Belles in charge.
You know, the games are a lot of fun, but I think my favorite part is having you on the sidelines cheering me on, Cap.
Yeah? Well, I hope I'm not distracting you too much. I don't want to distract you.
Nah, sprinting has just never been my thing. Now, if it was a marathon, I'd be running circles around those other Belles.
Oh, are you getting competitive now?
Oh, don't get me wrong, I'm still having the best time, and all the other Belles are amazing. I just want to be sure to show them how amazing I am too.
Well, I don't think you have to worry about that, Nautilus. You're definitely giving them a run for their money.
@BATTLE
You're sweet to me, Cap. Thanks! In fact, I think I--
*ALARM*
Way to spoil a nice moment, Morganas!
That was so much fun!
Really? Even though you almost came in last place?
It was a potato sack race! You can't spend your day jumping around in a sack and not have fun.

Fields.MenuText: You have a point.
That doesn't sound even remotely fun to me.
You know what's even more fun? Winning.

Fields.DialogueText: Right? I mean, there's a reason that race was nothing but laughter and giggles.
Sounds like somebody has to learn how to have a good time.
If you're not having fun while you're winning, then you're actually losing.
Hey, Cap, why don't you take my sack out for a spin? I promise you, it's so much fun!
No thanks, Nautilus. I don't think it'd be half as much fun if you weren't hopping around with me.
That's a good point. I guess we should get ready for the last event instead.
Well, all that's left is the javelin toss, and after that, the awards ceremony. You can't forget that. You're getting two whole medals, after all.
Golly, I guess I did pretty good, huh?
*ALARM*
Well, let's keep up that good streak! Though, I don't have any medals to award for Morgana fighting.
That's okay, two is more than enough for me. I've only got the one neck after all.
@BATTLE
So, is this supposed to be the javelin toss competition? Where are the targets? I can't see anything in this fog.
It is really foggy all of a sudden. It's not usually this bad around here, is it?
What are you thinking, Nautilus?
I'm worried that this fog isn't fog at all. It looks too familiar.

Fields.MenuText: It looks like fog to me.
Familiar how?
You have a point. I think I've seen that particular shade before...

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't remind you anything? Any particular Morgana we've tussled with?
I'm reminded of something Asphyxiation used during one of our encounters.
Yeah... It's not natural. I'm almost sure of it.
We should tell someone. We should sound the alarms or something.
*BOOM*
Sounds like it's too late for that.
*BOOM*
Looks like some of the other Belles have started the fight. We should join them.
They've got that side. Let's take this group over here!
@BATTLE
That was Asphyxiation! I'm positive, I just know it!
It could've been, but we didn't see any subs in the fray.
You wouldn't. She's sneaky like that.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't that kinda like the pot calling the kettle black?
It could've been a different Morgana with a similar ability.
I suppose it could've been her...

Fields.DialogueText: I can be sneaky too, but I'm the good kind of sneaky. She's the evil kind.
But, Asphyxiation's got it out for me. You think this was just a coincidence?
So, you think so too! See, we gotta' go after her!
Did you hear anything during the battle? Did she speak to you?
No, but she wouldn't have. She would've known that I'd go after her as soon as I heard her.
All right, I trust you. Let's find Asphyxiation before she attacks again.
That's my Cap. Golly, ya know, this is why you're my favorite.
Maybe you should save the praise for after we actually find her.
No way, Cap. You already made me smile. There's no way it's going away anytime soon.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Knock it off, Morganas! I was trying to have a nice moment with Cap! Ugh...
*BOOM*
Morganas? They sensed us this deep underwater?
Yeah, that might've been my fault.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean?
Oh, I seriously doubt that. Don't be so hard on yourself.
Honestly? I'm not surprised.

Fields.DialogueText: I may, or may not, have accidentally gotten spotted outside the ship.
No... I'm, pretty sure it's my fault. I got spotted.
I guess you just know me too well, huh, Cap? I hope it's not 'cause I'm predictable or something.
I was taking a little swim through some kelp nearby, trying to relax a little, and that's when I realized I wasn't alone. A Morgana sub spotted me.
Well, next time, can you try and find a less dangerous way to relax?
*BOOM*
Yeah, I think I can handle that. Sorry again, Cap.
Eh, I can't stay mad at that face.
Good thing too. Because it's probably gonna happen again.
@BATTLE
We should quit starting at each other's faces and get to battle stations... probably...
Right... right...
All right, let's finish this restock ASAP! We need to get back to looking for Asphyxiation.
You're right. We haven't found any trace of her yet. She's getting further away every second.
Exactly. Gosh, I wish she wasn't so sneaky.

Fields.MenuText: What if we're looking in the wrong place?
What if she's too sneaky?
Maybe we should just give up...

Fields.DialogueText: You mean so deep underwater? Asphyxiation wouldn't be anywhere else.
Applesauce, you have a point... We're going to need more magnifying glasses to find this sneaky snake.
No way, Cap! I don't want to hear that defeatist attitude from you, definitely not from you!
Right now, we need to worry about one thing and one thing only. Restocking.
You're right. We should also keep an ear open for any rumors around port. Maybe Asphyxiation has been causing someone else trouble recently.
That's a fantastic idea, Cap! This is why you're the boss.
Well, that and the fancy outfit.
No one wears it better.
Okay, okay, enough complimenting me. Let's hit the rumor mill.
That rumor mill need to wait just a moment. I sense something...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Nautilus, I think I found us a lead.
A lead? That's fantastic! I was starting to get worried.
I overheard someone speaking about a Morgana ambushing ships with noxious fog. Sound like anyone we know?
That's gotta be Asphyxiation. That's amazing, Cap!
Oh, it was nothing. I just kept an ear open.
Ambushing random ships doesn't exactly sound like her style though, hmmmm...

Fields.MenuText: Well, if you want, we can ask her when we beat her.
It might not be her. This could take us in a direction we're not expecting.
Maybe that's why she's doing it. We wouldn't expect it.

Fields.DialogueText: Heheheh, I've got a lot I'd like to ask when I get my hands on her.
I'm going to choose not to believe that. We're going exactly where we think we're going.
Ya' know, she is tricky like that...
Well, let's get on our way. Where's our destination?
Last sighted heading north. I figure if we hurry, we can catch up with her.
Then we better hurry!
@BATTLE
We might find some trouble along the way...
Hey, Nautilus, I was hoping to...
Eek, Cap, what is it?!
Uh... I wanted to talk to you about tactics, but now I'm curious about what you're hiding behind your back.
Nothing! I have nothing behind my back. Golly, quit with the third degree, Cap, gosh!
Hmmmm...

Fields.MenuText: Is that a French - English dictionary on your bed?
Are you hiding a present for me behind your back!?
Did you steal something? What's going on here?

Fields.DialogueText: Uh... No! That's... That's just a normal everyday dictionary.
Um... Yes! Yes, that's why I can't show you. Exactly!
I'd never steal something, Cap! How dare you even suggest something like that? I'm going to have to ask you to leave. Now!
Okay, you know you can tell me anything, right? I can tell when you're keeping something from me. You're a horrible liar.
I... Okay, fine. It's embarrassing, but here.
You were writing on your arms? They're covered in text. Is that French?
It's a bunch of different languages. It's a cheat sheet. I didn't want to forget again.
I told you I would help you with this, didn't I? You didn't have to resort to a cheat sheet, Nautilus.
I... I wanted to impress you.
Well, you can consider me impressed. You clearly went to a lot of effort. I didn't know you could write with both your hands. Now that's impressive.
Oh, stop it. It's not that great.
And, hey, maybe the information will just soak in through your skin. It could turn out to be a new studying technique.
Heheh, if only that's how it worked. I'd know every language there is.
Now there's the smile I love to see.
*ALARM*
Oh, phooey, just when I'm starting to have fun too.
There'll be plenty of time for fun after.
I hope you're right, Cap.
@BATTLE
Are we moving more slowly than usual?
It's the water. I think it's thicker than normal. I'm going to go check it out.

Fields.MenuText: Be careful, Nautilus.
Yeah, that seems like a smart idea.
You know, sometimes I wish I could just walk through walls like you.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap. I will.
Well, golly, yeah. I have a lot of those.
Yeah, I'm not gonna lie. It's pretty incredible.
I'll be back in a quick sec. See ya' soon.
If those rumors are right, we're probably being...
Holy Honeycombs! That is... Blech, I can hardly breathe. It's not good out there.
Noxious, huh? We must be getting close.
*ALARM*
Based on what I'm hearing, I think we're surrounded, Cap.
That's what I was afraid of.
Asphyxiation must be watching from somewhere nearby. She must be enjoying this.
Hopefully, she'll pop her head out and say hello. Otherwise, we're going to have to chase her down after the battle.
And, we all know how she loves to run and hide.
@BATTLE
Whoa, it looks like the gas is even worse up on the surface.
Where is that Asphyxiation hiding? We need to shut off this fog to find her, but we need to find her to shut it off. What are we supposed to do?
I'm not seeing Asphyxiation up there, but there are a few more Morgana ships closing in on us.
Let me see. Applesauce, that one's huge! Hey, doesn't it look like the fog is kind of rolling off from that ship?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe... I don't know, it's hard to tell through all this poisonous gas.
What, you think Asphyxiation put on a few pounds and became an aircraft carrier?
Yeah, it looks like that ship could be the source...

Fields.DialogueText: Well, if it really is the source, it'd make sense that the gas would be thicker near it.
Hahah, maybe, Cap. Maybe she got too big and chunky to keep being all sneaky.
Then that's our next target. We need to destroy it.
If that thing's the source, then where is Asphyxiation?
Hmmm... What if she's on that ship? Maybe that's why it's so big.
*BOOM*
Looks like we're getting within range of their shots. Let's put up a fight of our own.
Whether she's on there or not, we're settling this today! Let's go, Cap!
@BATTLE
I think we can safely say that if Asphyxiation was ever here, she's not anymore.
Golly, ya' know, I'm starting to think it was never her. Maybe I just wanted it to be her.
You still have an unsettled score with her, huh?
Yeah, I do, but honestly, it's not that important anymore. We did a good job taking that nasty beast down.

Fields.MenuText: You're giving up a grudge that easily?
We did, didn't we? I honestly wasn't sure we were going to make it through that fight, though.
I think it's important. She's a threat, and we're going to have to do something about her eventually.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, don't get me wrong, it's not easy. I've just got my sights set on more important things now.
What?! You were that worried? I had no idea, I thought with you leading the way, we had it in the bag from the very beginning.
I know you're right. I just mean that it's not my singular goal anymore. There are more Morganas in the sea.
Hey, I have a great idea. How about we celebrate!? We deserve it after all this, don't we?
Celebrate... What do you have in mind?
Well, we could have a big party in the mess hall, or...
Ohhh, we've gotta have cake, and hats, and games, and... Ooooh, I'll bring the champagne!
Heh, sounds like we'd better make port. We've got supplies to pick up.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
But first things first, Cap!
Cheers, everyone!
Cheers!
I guess everyone needed a little time off, huh?
Everyone loves a party! Drink up, Cap!
Is this champagne?
It's a celebration, isn't it? All good celebrations need a little bubbly. Now, drink!

Fields.MenuText: No, thank you, someone has to keep their wits about them on this sub.
I guess one glass couldn't hurt.
Don't mind if I do. I love this stuff!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, phooey on you. You're a fun-stopper, Cap.
That's the spirit! Bottoms up!
Not as much as I do! It's so fizzy and wonderful!
How many glasses have you had, Nautilus?
Glasses? I don't wear glasses. I have perfect vision.
You're pretty adorable when you've been drinking, you know that?
Well, you're pretty adorable... in general. Or in admiral. Hehe... Get it? Hey, Cap, didja get--
*ALARM*
Woo, woo, woo, what's that? Did someone put on music?
That's not music, Nautilus. That's the alarm. We've got Morganas incoming.
Well, that's silly. Who would set off an alarm in the middle of a party? Bad Morganas!
Let's hope not everyone is as drunk as you.
Drunk? Bubbly doesn't get you drunk.
Sure it doesn't, Nautilus, sure it doesn't.
@BATTLE
Hey, Cap, you got a second?
Always for you, Nautilus. What do you need?
I just wanted to apologize really quickly about that party before. I might've gotten the crew a little too worked up.

Fields.MenuText: No, it's okay. It was a party. What's a party without copious amounts of drinking?
It's okay, you were pretty adorable after all that champagne.
Yeah, maybe next time we should double up on the cake instead of the drinks.

Fields.DialogueText: That was my frame of mind. Until the Morganas showed up, of course.
Adorable? Stop it, Cap, you're gonna make me blush.
I do like cake. It's not as fun as bubbly, though.
Anyway, I... Ya' know, we've been through a lot together, and... Hold on, gimme a second.
Whoa, straight from the bottle? I thought we drank all the champagne.
I saved some of the good stuff for us, but I need it right now. I'll try not to drink all of it.
What's going on, Nautilus?
I have something that I want to say to you, Cap.
Oh... So, you're using the champagne to work up the courage to say is?
Yeah! That's it, exactly!
Well, you definitely picked the good stuff for your liquid courage.
So? Do you... Could you... Do you think... we work together, but... are we real friends?
Nautilus, I care a great deal about you. There is no one that has my trust, and faith, more than you.
Really?
*ALARM*
No! Damn Morganas! I was having a moment with my buddy, Cap!
Great, now I'm not going to be able to stop smiling during this whole fight.
You sure that's not just from the bubbly?
That might be some of it. But it's mostly you and your compliment, Cap!
@BATTLE
Nautilus, you've got a package. It's pretty weighty for such a small box.
Oooh, gimme' it! I wanna see what's inside!
Whoa, calm down. No need to snatch it out of my hands. I would've just handed it to you.
Sorry, I'm just so excited. Oh, see, this must be something about the All Belle Games. Oooh, a letter.
What's it say?
"We're sorry you missed the last event, as well as the ceremony. You would've loved it. Lots of champagne." They know me so well.
Sounds like it.
Oh, oh! The package has the medals I won!

Fields.MenuText: You won medals? I almost forgot about that.
A bronze and a gold, right? Whip 'em out, I wanna see.
About time, I was wondering if I'd ever see them.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, we have been a little busy lately, huh?
I'm trying, I'm trying. There's a whole lot of packing material in here.
Why do you care so much? They're my medals. I was patient.
Holy... The gold one is so much bigger than the bronze one!
Does that really surprise you? It makes sense to me.
Hmmm... You know what... Here, I want you to have this.
Your gold medal? What? There's no way I can accept this, you earned it. You won the obstacle course competition.
You earned it too. You helped me so much with my training. Just put it on, I want to see you in it.
I... Okay. How do I look?
You look amazing. Gold is certainly your color.
It's a little heavy. I better not fall overboard.
*ALARM*
Oh, we've got Morganas incoming. Let's show them how we earned these medals!
By jumping over obstacles and sprinting?
You know what I mean, Cap! Let's give 'em what for!
